message_1:
Suppose a Hill cipher encryption key matrix is given as:
$$ K = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 5 \end{bmatrix} $$ 
and a plaintext message is "MATH". Convert the letters to numbers using the standard A=0, B=1, ..., Z=25 mapping. What is the corresponding ciphertext message using Hill cipher encryption with the given key?
message_2:
First, we need to convert the plaintext message "MATH" into numbers using the given mapping. We get:

M = 12
A = 0
T = 19
H = 7

Now, we need to arrange these numbers into a column matrix and apply the Hill cipher encryption using the given key matrix K. Since the key matrix is 2x2, we will arrange the numbers into two 2x1 matrices:

$$ P_1 = \begin{bmatrix} 12 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix} $$ and $$ P_2 = \begin{bmatrix} 19 \\ 7 \end{bmatrix} $$

Now, we will multiply the key matrix K with each of the plaintext matrices:

$$ C_1 = K \times P_1 = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 5 \end{bmatrix} \times \begin{bmatrix} 12 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 24 \\ 12 \end{bmatrix} $$

$$ C_2 = K \times P_2 = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 5 \end{bmatrix} \times \begin{bmatrix} 19 \\ 7 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 61 \\ 54 \end{bmatrix} $$

Now, we need to reduce the resulting matrices modulo 26:

$$ C_1 = \begin{bmatrix} 24 \mod 26 \\ 12 \mod 26 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 24 \\ 12 \end{bmatrix} $$

$$ C_2 = \begin{bmatrix} 61 \mod 26 \\ 54 \mod 26 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 9 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix} $$

Now, we convert the numbers back to letters using the given mapping:

24 = X
12 = M
9 = J
2 = C

So, the ciphertext message is "XMJC".
